timeline.bodyText:
I have some questions:

Will this leave some retry Xids in the preparedXids?
If the job is failed, will the job restart the checkpoint from checkpoint: 0?
If yes, will the retry Xids in the preparedXids not be comitted for a long time?
timeline.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText:
Yes, failed Xds will be returned to preparedXids again
The job will restart from the latest completed checkpoint if any (decided by CheckpointCoordinator )
Upon restart, preparedXids will be committed again (or erlier, if a checkpoint completion notification is received before restart)
replies.author: rkhachatryan

timeline.bodyText: I'm a little confused about this. Does this mean we can't provide exactly once guarantee across partititons?
timeline.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText:
Let me clarify.
Each element is sent to the external system exactly once (even across partitions).
However, each partition commits independently (with a potentially big delay because of retries).
Therefore, the data in the external system may be inconsistent during these periods from the application point of view.
I believe this is a common behavior of all Flink exatly-once sinks.
replies.author: rkhachatryan
